subject: Languages
title: Endangered Sign Languages
description: A quick, practical guide to Endangered Sign Languages.

hook.text: Sign languages can go extinct too. Many indigenous sign languages are dying as communities shrink.

buildup.text: Village sign languages in Bali, Ghana, and Mexico developed over generations in small communities.

discovery.text: As deaf children are sent to mainstream schools using national sign languages, village signs fade.

twist.text: Ironically, access to 'better' education can kill unique sign languages just as it kills spoken ones.

climax.text: Linguists are racing to document endangered sign languages before they disappear.

punchline.text: Even languages without a single written word can go extinct.

quiz.question: What threatens indigenous village sign languages?
options: Children learning national sign languages in mainstream schools
